model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__li.name: stg_mailchimp__lists
model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__li.description: Each record represents a list in Mailchimp.

list_id.name: list_id
list_id.description: The unique ID of a list.

date_created.name: date_created
date_created.description: The date and time that a list was created.

list_rating.name: list_rating
list_rating.description: An auto-generated activity score for the list (0-5).

contact_address_1.name: contact_address_1
contact_address_1.description: The street address for the list contact.

contact_address_2.name: contact_address_2
contact_address_2.description: The street address for the list contact.

contact_city.name: contact_city
contact_city.description: The city for the list contact.

contact_company.name: contact_company
contact_company.description: The company name for the list.

contact_country.name: contact_country
contact_country.description: A two-character ISO3166 country code. Defaults to US if invalid.

contact_state.name: contact_state
contact_state.description: The state for the list contact.

contact_zip.name: contact_zip
contact_zip.description: The postal or zip code for the list contact.

default_from_email.name: default_from_email
default_from_email.description: The default from email for campaigns sent to a list.

default_from_name.name: default_from_name
default_from_name.description: The default from name for campaigns sent to a list.

default_language.name: default_language
default_language.description: The default language for a lists's forms.

default_subject.name: default_subject
default_subject.description: The default subject line for campaigns sent to a list.

email_type_option.name: email_type_option
email_type_option.description: Whether the list supports multiple formats for emails.  When set to true, subscribers can choose whether they want to receive HTML or plain-text emails.  When set to false, subscribers will receive HTML emails, with a plain-text alternative backup.

notify_on_subscribe.name: notify_on_subscribe
notify_on_subscribe.description: The email address to send subscribe notifications to.

notify_on_unsubscribe.name: notify_on_unsubscribe
notify_on_unsubscribe.description: The email address to send unsubscribe notifications to.

permission_reminder.name: permission_reminder
permission_reminder.description: The permission reminder for a list.

subscribe_url_long.name: subscribe_url_long
subscribe_url_long.description: The full version of a list's subscribe form (host will vary).

subscribe_url_short.name: subscribe_url_short
subscribe_url_short.description: Mailchimp's EepURL shortened version of a list's subscribe form.

use_archive_bar.name: use_archive_bar
use_archive_bar.description: Whether campaigns for this list use the Archive Bar in archives by default.

visibility.name: visibility
visibility.description: Whether this list is public or private.

model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__au.name: stg_mailchimp__automation_activities
model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__au.description: Each record represents an activity taken in relation to a automation email.

action_type.name: action_type
action_type.description: One of the following actions: 'open', 'click', or 'bounce'

automation_email_id.name: automation_email_id
automation_email_id.description: The ID for the automation email that relates to the activity.

member_id.name: member_id
member_id.description: The ID of the member the activity relates to.

list_id.name: list_id
list_id.description: The ID of the list the email was sent to.

activity_timestamp.name: activity_timestamp
activity_timestamp.description: The timestamp when the activity occurred.

ip_address.name: ip_address
ip_address.description: The IP address recorded for the action.

url.name: url
url.description: If the action is a 'click', the URL on which the member clicked.

bounce_type.name: bounce_type
bounce_type.description: If the action is a 'bounce', the type of bounce received: 'hard', 'soft'.

model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__ca.name: stg_mailchimp__campaigns
model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__ca.description: Each record represents a campaign in Mailchimp.

campaign_id.name: campaign_id
campaign_id.description: The ID of the campaign in Mailchimp.

segment_id.name: segment_id
segment_id.description: The ID of the Segment a campaign was sent to.

create_timestamp.name: create_timestamp
create_timestamp.description: The date and time the campaign was created.

send_timestamp.name: send_timestamp
send_timestamp.description: The date and time a campaign was sent.

list_id.name: list_id
list_id.description: The ID of the List a campaign was sent to.

reply_to_email.name: reply_to_email
reply_to_email.description: The reply-to email address for the campaign.

campaign_type.name: campaign_type
campaign_type.description: The type of campaign sent.  Possible values: regular, plaintext, absplit, variate, rss.

archive_url.name: archive_url
archive_url.description: The link to the campaign's archive version in ISO 8601 format.

authenticate.name: authenticate
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp authenticated the campaign. Defaults to true.

auto_footer.name: auto_footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append Mailchimp's default footer to the campaign.

auto_tweet.name: auto_tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the campaign archive page when the campaign is sent.

clicktale.name: clicktale
clicktale.description: The custom slug for ClickTale tracking (max of 50 bytes).

content_type.name: content_type
content_type.description: How the campaign's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

drag_and_drop.name: drag_and_drop
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the campaign uses the drag-and-drop editor.

fb_comments.name: fb_comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the campaign (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to true.

folder_id.name: folder_id
folder_id.description: If the campaign is listed in a folder, the ID for that folder.

from_name.name: from_name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the campaign (not an email address).

google_analytics.name: google_analytics
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for Google Analytics tracking (max of 50 bytes).

inline_css.name: inline_css
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the campaign content.

long_archive_url.name: long_archive_url
long_archive_url.description: The original link to the campaign's archive version.

status.name: status
status.description: The current status of the campaign.

subject_line.name: subject_line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the campaign.

template_id.name: template_id
template_id.description: The ID for the template used in this campaign.

test_size.name: test_size
test_size.description: The percentage of recipients to send the test combinations to, must be a value between 10 and 100.

to_name.name: to_name
to_name.description: The campaign's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name merge field.

track_html_clicks.name: track_html_clicks
track_html_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the HTML version of the campaign. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

track_opens.name: track_opens
track_opens.description: Whether to track opens. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

track_text_clicks.name: track_text_clicks
track_text_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the plain-text version of the campaign. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

use_conversation.name: use_conversation
use_conversation.description: Use Mailchimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

wait_time.name: wait_time
wait_time.description: The number of minutes to wait before choosing the winning campaign. The value of wait_time must be greater than 0 and in whole hours, specified in minutes.

winner_criteria.name: winner_criteria
winner_criteria.description: The combination that performs the best.  This may be determined automatically by click rate, open rate, or total revenue—or  you may choose manually based on the reporting data you find the most valuable.  For Multivariate Campaigns testing send_time, winner_criteria is ignored.  For Multivariate Campaigns with 'manual' as the winner_criteria, the winner must be chosen in the Mailchimp web application.

winning_campaign_id.name: winning_campaign_id
winning_campaign_id.description: ID of the campaign that was sent to the remaining recipients based on the winning combination.

model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__au.name: stg_mailchimp__automation_emails
model.mailchimp_source.stg_mailchimp__au.description: Each record represents an automation email (that make up automations).

automation_email_id.name: automation_email_id
automation_email_id.description: The ID of the automation email.

automation_id.name: automation_id
automation_id.description: The ID of the automation an email relates to.

created_timestamp.name: created_timestamp
created_timestamp.description: The date and time the automation email was created.

started_timestamp.name: started_timestamp
started_timestamp.description: The date and time the automation email was started.

send_timestamp.name: send_timestamp
send_timestamp.description: The date and time the automation email was sent.

from_name.name: from_name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the automation email (not an email address).

reply_to.name: reply_to
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the automation.

status.name: status
status.description: The current status of the automation email.

subject_line.name: subject_line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the automation email.

title.name: title
title.description: The title of the automation email.

to_name.name: to_name
to_name.description: The automation email's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name merge field.

archive_url.name: archive_url
archive_url.description: The link to the automation email's archive version in ISO 8601 format.

authenticate.name: authenticate
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp authenticated the automation email. Defaults to true.

auto_footer.name: auto_footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append Mailchimp's default footer to the automation email.

auto_tweet.name: auto_tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the automation email archive page when the automation email is sent.

clicktale.name: clicktale
clicktale.description: The custom slug for ClickTale tracking (max of 50 bytes).

content_type.name: content_type
content_type.description: How the automation email's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

delay_action.name: delay_action
delay_action.description: The action that triggers the delay of an Automation email.

delay_action_description.name: delay_action_description
delay_action_description.description: The user-friendly description of the action that triggers an Automation email.

delay_amount.name: delay_amount
delay_amount.description: The delay amount for an Automation email.

delay_direction.name: delay_direction
delay_direction.description: Whether the delay settings describe before or after the delay action of an Automation email.

delay_full_description.name: delay_full_description
delay_full_description.description: The user-friendly description of the delay and trigger action settings for an Automation email.

delay_type.name: delay_type
delay_type.description: The type of delay for an Automation email.

drag_and_drop.name: drag_and_drop
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the automation email uses the drag-and-drop editor.

fb_comments.name: fb_comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the automation email (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to true.

folder_id.name: folder_id
folder_id.description: If the automation email is listed in a folder, the ID for that folder.

google_analytics.name: google_analytics
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for Google Analytics tracking (max of 50 bytes).

inline_css.name: inline_css
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the automation email content.

position.name: position
position.description: The position of an Automation email in a workflow.

template_id.name: template_id
template_id.description: The ID for the template used in this automation email.

timewarp.name: timewarp
timewarp.description: Send this automation email using Timewarpe_this

track_html_clicks.name: track_html_clicks
track_html_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the HTML version of the automation email. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

track_opens.name: track_opens
track_opens.description: Whether to track opens. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate automation emails.

track_text_clicks.name: track_text_clicks
track_text_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the plain-text version of the automation email. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

use_conversation.name: use_conversation
use_conversation.description: Use Mailchimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

email_type.name: email_type

status.name: status

list_id.name: list_id

last_changed_timestamp.name: last_changed_timestamp

country_code.name: country_code
country_code.description: The member's unique code for the location country.

dstoff.name: dstoff
dstoff.description: The member's offset for timezones where daylight saving time is observed.

gmtoff.name: gmtoff
gmtoff.description: The member's time difference in hours from GMT.

opt_in_ip_address.name: opt_in_ip_address
opt_in_ip_address.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

signup_ip_address.name: signup_ip_address
signup_ip_address.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

member_rating.name: member_rating
member_rating.description: Star rating for this member, between 1 and 5.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: The timezone for the member's location.

unique_email_id.name: unique_email_id
unique_email_id.description: An identifier for the address across all of Mailchimp.

id.description: The ID of the automation in Mailchimp.

list_id.name: list_id
list_id.description: The ID of the List an automation was sent to.

segment_id.name: segment_id
segment_id.description: The ID of the Segment an automation was sent to.

segment_text.name: segment_text
segment_text.description: The field describing the Segment an automation was sent to.

start_time.name: start_time
start_time.description: The date and time the Automation was started.

create_time.name: create_time
create_time.description: The date and time the Automation was created.

status.name: status
status.description: The current status of the Automation. Possible Values: save, paused, sending

_fivetran_synced.name: _fivetran_synced
_fivetran_synced.description: UTC timestamp that indicates the time when Fivetran last successfully synced the row.

_fivetran_deleted.name: _fivetran_deleted

source.mailchimp_source.mailchimp.automa.name: automation_email
source.mailchimp_source.mailchimp.automa.description: Each record represents an automation email (that make up automations).

automation_id.name: automation_id
automation_id.description: The ID of the automation an email relates to.

create_time.name: create_time
create_time.description: The date and time the automation email was created.

start_time.name: start_time
start_time.description: The date and time the automation email was started.

send_time.name: send_time
send_time.description: The date and time the automation email was sent.

from_name.name: from_name
from_name.description: The 'from' name on the automation email (not an email address).

reply_to.name: reply_to
reply_to.description: The reply-to email address for the automation.

status.name: status
status.description: The current status of the automation email.

subject_line.name: subject_line
subject_line.description: The subject line for the automation email.

title.name: title
title.description: The title for the automation email.

to_name.name: to_name
to_name.description: The automation email's custom 'To' name. Typically the first name merge field.

archive_url.name: archive_url
archive_url.description: The link to the automation email's archive version in ISO 8601 format.

authenticate.name: authenticate
authenticate.description: Whether Mailchimp authenticated the automation email. Defaults to true.

auto_footer.name: auto_footer
auto_footer.description: Automatically append Mailchimp's default footer to the automation email.

auto_tweet.name: auto_tweet
auto_tweet.description: Automatically tweet a link to the automation email archive page when the automation email is sent.

clicktale.name: clicktale
clicktale.description: The custom slug for ClickTale tracking (max of 50 bytes).

content_type.name: content_type
content_type.description: How the automation email's content is put together ('template', 'drag_and_drop', 'html', 'url').

delay_action.name: delay_action
delay_action.description: The action that triggers the delay of an Automation email.

delay_action_description.name: delay_action_description
delay_action_description.description: The user-friendly description of the action that triggers an Automation email.

delay_amount.name: delay_amount
delay_amount.description: The delay amount for an Automation email.

delay_direction.name: delay_direction
delay_direction.description: Whether the delay settings describe before or after the delay action of an Automation email.

delay_full_description.name: delay_full_description
delay_full_description.description: The user-friendly description of the delay and trigger action settings for an Automation email.

delay_type.name: delay_type
delay_type.description: The type of delay for an Automation email.

drag_and_drop.name: drag_and_drop
drag_and_drop.description: Whether the automation email uses the drag-and-drop editor.

fb_comments.name: fb_comments
fb_comments.description: Allows Facebook comments on the automation email (also force-enables the Campaign Archive toolbar). Defaults to true.

folder_id.name: folder_id
folder_id.description: If the automation email is listed in a folder, the ID for that folder.

google_analytics.name: google_analytics
google_analytics.description: The custom slug for Google Analytics tracking (max of 50 bytes).

inline_css.name: inline_css
inline_css.description: Automatically inline the CSS included with the automation email content.

position.name: position
position.description: The position of an Automation email in a workflow.

template_id.name: template_id
template_id.description: The ID for the template used in this automation email.

timewarp.name: timewarp
timewarp.description: Send this automation email using Timewarpe_this

track_html_clicks.name: track_html_clicks
track_html_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the HTML version of the automation email. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

track_opens.name: track_opens
track_opens.description: Whether to track opens. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate automation emails.

track_text_clicks.name: track_text_clicks
track_text_clicks.description: Whether to track clicks in the plain-text version of the automation email. Defaults to true. Cannot be set to false for variate campaigns.

use_conversation.name: use_conversation
use_conversation.description: Use Mailchimp Conversation feature to manage out-of-office replies.

macro.dbt_bigquery.bigquery__get_catalog.name: bigquery__get_catalog
macro.dbt_bigquery.bigquery__get_catalog.macro_sql:
{% macro bigquery__get_catalog(information_schema, schemas) -%}

  {%- if (schemas | length) == 0 -%}
    {# Hopefully nothing cares about the columns we return when there are no rows #}
    {%- set query  = "select 1 as id limit 0" -%}
  {%- else -%}

  {%- set query -%}
    with tables as (
        select
            project_id as table_database,
            dataset_id as table_schema,
            table_id as original_table_name,

            concat(project_id, '.', dataset_id, '.', table_id) as relation_id,

            row_count,
            size_bytes as size_bytes,
            case
                when type = 1 then 'table'
                when type = 2 then 'view'
                else 'external'
            end as table_type,

            REGEXP_CONTAINS(table_id, '^.+[0-9]{8}$') and coalesce(type, 0) = 1 as is_date_shard,
            REGEXP_EXTRACT(table_id, '^(.+)[0-9]{8}$') as shard_base_name,
            REGEXP_EXTRACT(table_id, '^.+([0-9]{8})$') as shard_name

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='__TABLES__') }}
        where (
          {%- for schema in schemas -%}
            upper(dataset_id) = upper('{{ schema }}'){%- if not loop.last %} or {% endif -%}
          {%- endfor -%}
        )
    ),

    extracted as (

        select *,
            case
                when is_date_shard then shard_base_name
                else original_table_name
            end as table_name

        from tables

    ),

    unsharded_tables as (

        select
            table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,
            coalesce(table_type, 'external') as table_type,
            is_date_shard,

            struct(
                min(shard_name) as shard_min,
                max(shard_name) as shard_max,
                count(*) as shard_count
            ) as table_shards,

            sum(size_bytes) as size_bytes,
            sum(row_count) as row_count,

            max(relation_id) as relation_id

        from extracted
        group by 1,2,3,4,5

    ),

    info_schema_columns as (

        select
            concat(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) as relation_id,
            table_catalog as table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,

            -- use the "real" column name from the paths query below
            column_name as base_column_name,
            ordinal_position as column_index,

            is_partitioning_column,
            clustering_ordinal_position

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='COLUMNS') }}
        where ordinal_position is not null

    ),

    info_schema_column_paths as (

        select
            concat(table_catalog, '.', table_schema, '.', table_name) as relation_id,
            field_path as column_name,
            data_type as column_type,
            column_name as base_column_name,
            description as column_comment

        from {{ information_schema.replace(information_schema_view='COLUMN_FIELD_PATHS') }}

    ),

    columns as (

        select * except (base_column_name)
        from info_schema_columns
        join info_schema_column_paths using (relation_id, base_column_name)

    ),

    column_stats as (

        select
            table_database,
            table_schema,
            table_name,
            max(relation_id) as relation_id,
            max(case when is_partitioning_column = 'YES' then 1 else 0 end) = 1 as is_partitioned,
            max(case when is_partitioning_column = 'YES' then column_name else null end) as partition_column,
            max(case when clustering_ordinal_position is not null then 1 else 0 end) = 1 as is_clustered,
            array_to_string(
                array_agg(
                    case
                        when clustering_ordinal_position is not null then column_name
                        else null
                    end ignore nulls
                    order by clustering_ordinal_position
                ), ', '
            ) as clustering_columns

        from columns
        group by 1,2,3

    )

    select
        unsharded_tables.table_database,
        unsharded_tables.table_schema,
        case
            when is_date_shard then concat(unsharded_tables.table_name, '*')
            else unsharded_tables.table_name
        end as table_name,
        unsharded_tables.table_type,

        -- coalesce name and type for External tables - these columns are not
        -- present in the COLUMN_FIELD_PATHS resultset
        coalesce(columns.column_name, '<unknown>') as column_name,
        -- invent a row number to account for nested fields -- BQ does
        -- not treat these nested properties as independent fields
        row_number() over (
            partition by relation_id
            order by columns.column_index, columns.column_name
        ) as column_index,
        coalesce(columns.column_type, '<unknown>') as column_type,
        columns.column_comment,

        'Shard count' as `stats__date_shards__label`,
        table_shards.shard_count as `stats__date_shards__value`,
        'The number of date shards in this table' as `stats__date_shards__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shards__include`,

        'Shard (min)' as `stats__date_shard_min__label`,
        table_shards.shard_min as `stats__date_shard_min__value`,
        'The first date shard in this table' as `stats__date_shard_min__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shard_min__include`,

        'Shard (max)' as `stats__date_shard_max__label`,
        table_shards.shard_max as `stats__date_shard_max__value`,
        'The last date shard in this table' as `stats__date_shard_max__description`,
        is_date_shard as `stats__date_shard_max__include`,

        '# Rows' as `stats__num_rows__label`,
        row_count as `stats__num_rows__value`,
        'Approximate count of rows in this table' as `stats__num_rows__description`,
        (unsharded_tables.table_type = 'table') as `stats__num_rows__include`,

        'Approximate Size' as `stats__num_bytes__label`,
        size_bytes as `stats__num_bytes__value`,
        'Approximate size of table as reported by BigQuery' as `stats__num_bytes__description`,
        (unsharded_tables.table_type = 'table') as `stats__num_bytes__include`,

        'Partitioned By' as `stats__partitioning_type__label`,
        partition_column as `stats__partitioning_type__value`,
        'The partitioning column for this table' as `stats__partitioning_type__description`,
        is_partitioned as `stats__partitioning_type__include`,

        'Clustered By' as `stats__clustering_fields__label`,
        clustering_columns as `stats__clustering_fields__value`,
        'The clustering columns for this table' as `stats__clustering_fields__description`,
        is_clustered as `stats__clustering_fields__include`

    -- join using relation_id (an actual relation, not a shard prefix) to make
    -- sure that column metadata is picked up through the join. This will only
    -- return the column information for the "max" table in a date-sharded table set
    from unsharded_tables
    left join columns using (relation_id)
    left join column_stats using (relation_id)
  {%- endset -%}

  {%- endif -%}

  {{ return(run_query(query)) }}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.name: default__snapshot_merge_sql
macro.dbt.default__snapshot_merge_sql.macro_sql:
{% macro default__snapshot_merge_sql(target, source, insert_cols) -%}
    {%- set insert_cols_csv = insert_cols | join(', ') -%}

    merge into {{ target }} as DBT_INTERNAL_DEST
    using {{ source }} as DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE
    on DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_scd_id = DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_scd_id

    when matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_DEST.dbt_valid_to is null
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type in ('update', 'delete')
        then update
        set dbt_valid_to = DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_valid_to

    when not matched
     and DBT_INTERNAL_SOURCE.dbt_change_type = 'insert'
        then insert ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
        values ({{ insert_cols_csv }})
    ;
{% endmacro %}

macro.dbt.snapshot_staging_table.macro_sql:
{% macro snapshot_staging_table(strategy, source_sql, target_relation) -%}

    with snapshot_query as (

        {{ source_sql }}

    ),

    snapshotted_data as (

        select *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key

        from {{ target_relation }}
        where dbt_valid_to is null

    ),

    insertions_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            nullif({{ strategy.updated_at }}, {{ strategy.updated_at }}) as dbt_valid_to,
            {{ strategy.scd_id }} as dbt_scd_id

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    updates_source_data as (

        select
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ strategy.updated_at }} as dbt_valid_to

        from snapshot_query
    ),

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}

    deletes_source_data as (

        select 
            *,
            {{ strategy.unique_key }} as dbt_unique_key
        from snapshot_query
    ),
    {% endif %}

    insertions as (

        select
            'insert' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*

        from insertions_source_data as source_data
        left outer join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is null
           or (
                snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key is not null
            and (
                {{ strategy.row_changed }}
            )
        )

    ),

    updates as (

        select
            'update' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id

        from updates_source_data as source_data
        join snapshotted_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where (
            {{ strategy.row_changed }}
        )
    )

    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes -%}
    ,

    deletes as (
    
        select
            'delete' as dbt_change_type,
            source_data.*,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_from,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_updated_at,
            {{ snapshot_get_time() }} as dbt_valid_to,
            snapshotted_data.dbt_scd_id
    
        from snapshotted_data
        left join deletes_source_data as source_data on snapshotted_data.dbt_unique_key = source_data.dbt_unique_key
        where source_data.dbt_unique_key is null
    )
    {%- endif %}

    select * from insertions
    union all
    select * from updates
    {%- if strategy.invalidate_hard_deletes %}
    union all
    select * from deletes
    {%- endif %}

{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt_utils.default__get_tables_by_p.macro_sql:
{% macro default__get_tables_by_pattern_sql(schema_pattern, table_pattern, exclude='', database=target.database) %}

        select distinct
            table_schema as "table_schema",
            table_name as "table_name",
            case table_type
                when 'BASE TABLE' then 'table'
                when 'EXTERNAL TABLE' then 'external'
                when 'MATERIALIZED VIEW' then 'materializedview'
                else lower(table_type)
            end as "table_type"
        from {{ database }}.information_schema.tables
        where table_schema ilike '{{ schema_pattern }}'
        and table_name ilike '{{ table_pattern }}'
        and table_name not ilike '{{ exclude }}'

{% endmacro %}

macro.fivetran_utils.bigquery__get_colum.macro_sql:
{% macro bigquery__get_columns_for_macro(table_name, schema_name, database_name=target.database) %}

{% set query %}

select
    concat(
      '{"name": "', 
      lower(column_name), 
      '", "datatype": ',
      case
        when lower(data_type) like '%timestamp%' then 'dbt_utils.type_timestamp()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'string' then 'dbt_utils.type_string()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'bool' then '"boolean"'
        when lower(data_type) = 'numeric' then 'dbt_utils.type_numeric()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'float64' then 'dbt_utils.type_float()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'int64' then 'dbt_utils.type_int()' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'date' then '"date"' 
        when lower(data_type) = 'datetime' then '"datetime"' 
      end,
      '}')
from `{{ database_name }}`.{{ schema_name }}.INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS
where lower(table_name) = '{{ table_name }}'
and lower(table_schema) = '{{ schema_name }}'
order by 1

{% endset %}

{% set results = run_query(query) %}
{% set results_list = results.columns[0].values() %}}

{{ return(results_list) }}

{% endmacro %}

dbt.__overview__.name: __overview__
dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--models` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

---

### More information

- [What is dbt](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/overview)?
- Read the [dbt viewpoint](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/viewpoint)
- [Installation](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/installation)
- Join the [chat](https://community.getdbt.com/) on Slack for live questions and support.
